bestBHT.bht: Luke's account goes into more detail than Matthew's, as Matthew does not mention any residence in Nazareth prior to Jesus' birth. The angel Gabriel appears both as a silent image and as a messenger of God's love, announcing the exalted love that Mary would be a part of. This hidden mystery was entrusted to Mary for later revelation to all believers. Let us submit humbly to God's plan, learning from Mary who carried the eternal wisdom of God. God kept Jesus hidden until the appointed time, when He would be revealed to all.

Henry Alford: In this particular the information of our Evangelist appears to be fuller than that of St. Matthew.
St. Matthew...seems not to be aware of any residence at Nazareth previous to the birth of our Lord.
Albert Barnes: In the sixth month - The sixth month after Elizabeth’s conception.
A city of Galilee named Nazareth - See the notes at Matthew 2:22-23.
Marvin Vincent: The angel who came down to earth with tidings Of peace that had been wept for many a year, And opened heaven from its long interdict, In front of us appeared so truthfully There sculptured in a gracious attitude, He did not seem an image that is silent.

One would have sworn that he was saying Ave! For she was there in effigy portrayed Who turned the key to ope the exalted love, And in her mien this language had impressed, Ecce ancilla Dei! as distinctly As any figure stamps itself in wax.

I am angelic love, that circle round The joy sublime which breathes out from the womb That was the hostelry of our desire; And I shall circle, Lady of heaven, while Thou followest thy Son, and mak'st diviner The sphere supreme, because thou enterest there.
John Calvin: The treasure of this mystery was committed by him to a virgin in such a manner, that at length, when the proper time came, it might be communicated to all the godly.

Let us learn, even when the reason does not immediately appear, to submit modestly to God, and let us not be ashamed to receive instruction from her who carried in her womb Christ the eternal 'wisdom of God.'
Yet we see how God kept his Son, as it were, in concealment, until the time of his full manifestation arrived, and then erected for him a platform, that he might be beheld by all.
Philip Schaff: In the sixth month. Not of the year, but of Elisabeth’s pregnancy.
Nazareth. The home of both Mary and Joseph, before the birth of Jesus.
Matthew (Matthew 2:23) speaks of their residence there, after the return from Egypt.
Archibald T. Robertson: The angel Gabriel is God's messenger to Mary as to Zacharias.
The angel Gabriel is God's messenger to Mary.
The angel Gabriel is God's messenger.
John Gill: John was before Christ, as man, being his forerunner; but Christ was preferred unto him as mediator, and existed before him, as the eternal Son of God.

the same angel, that near five hundred years before gave Daniel an exact account of the time of the Messiah's coming, and six months ago acquainted Zacharias with the conception, birth, character, and office of his forerunner.
the whole country of Galilee was mean and contemptible with the Jews [...] and yet hither an angel was sent by God; and here dwelt the mother of our Lord.
John Wesley: In the sixth month — After Elisabeth had conceived.

bhtAttempts.bht: In this particular, Luke provides more detailed information than Matthew, who seems unaware of any residence in Nazareth prior to the birth of Jesus. It is interesting to note that the angel Gabriel appears both as a silent image and as a messenger of God's love, announcing the exalted love that Mary would be a part of. Gabriel is the angelic circle of love around the joyous miracle of Jesus' birth. The treasure of this mystery was entrusted to Mary, so that it could be shared with all believers when the time was right. Let us humbly submit to God's plan, even when we do not fully understand it, and learn from Mary, who carried the eternal wisdom of God in her womb. God kept Jesus hidden until the appointed time and then revealed him for all to see.

Luke's account provides more extensive information compared to Matthew's, as Matthew seems unaware of any residence in Nazareth prior to Jesus' birth. The angel Gabriel appears as both a silent image and a messenger of God's love, proclaiming the exalted love that Mary would be a part of. This mystery was entrusted to Mary for later revelation to all believers. Let us humbly submit to God's plan, learning from Mary who carried the eternal wisdom of God. God kept Jesus hidden until the right time and then unveiled him for all to see.

Luke's account goes into more detail than Matthew's, as Matthew does not mention any residence in Nazareth prior to Jesus' birth. The angel Gabriel appears both as a silent image and as a messenger of God's love, announcing the exalted love that Mary would be a part of. This hidden mystery was entrusted to Mary for later revelation to all believers. Let us submit humbly to God's plan, learning from Mary who carried the eternal wisdom of God. God kept Jesus hidden until the appointed time, when He would be revealed to all.

Luke's account provides fuller information than Matthew's, indicating that Matthew may not be aware of any residence in Nazareth before Jesus' birth. The angel Gabriel is both a silent image and a messenger of God's love, proclaiming the exalted love Mary would experience. This mystery was entrusted to Mary, who carried the eternal wisdom of God in her womb. Let us humbly submit to God's plan, even when we don't fully understand it, and learn from Mary's example. God kept Jesus hidden until the right time, unveiling Him for all to see.

Luke's account offers more detailed information about Nazareth compared to Matthew's. The angel Gabriel appears both as a silent image and a messenger of God's love, informing Mary of the exalted love she would be a part of. This divine mystery was entrusted to Mary, who carried the eternal wisdom of God in her womb. Let us humbly submit to God's plan, even when we don't fully comprehend it, and learn from Mary, the vessel through whom Jesus was revealed to the world.
